prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The prism is centered on a white background. 1. **Create coordinate system** Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] degrees and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. **Draw the base sketch** We will create a sketch on the X-Y plane, which is the plane defined by the coordinate system. The base sketch will consist of 2 faces, face 1 and face 2, each containing one loop. Both loops have the same set of curves, so we'll just describe one of them. Loop 1 contains 4 arcs and 4 lines. The arcs and lines together form a polygon. - Arc 1: Start point at [0.0, 0.0417], midpoint at [0.0122, 0.0122], endpoint at [0.0417, 0.0] - Line 1: Start point at [0.0417, 0.0], end point at [0.7083, 0.0] - Arc 2: Start point at [0.7083, 0.0], midpoint at [0.7378, 0.0122], endpoint at [0.75, 0.0417] - Line 2: Start point at [0.75, 0.0417], endpoint at [0.75, 0.3958] - Arc 3: Start point at [0.75, 0.3958], midpoint at [0.7378, 0.4253], endpoint at [0.7083, 0.4375] - Line 3: Start point at [0.7083, 0.4375], endpoint at [0.0417, 0.4375] - Arc 4: Start point at [0.0417, 0.4375], midpoint at [0.0122, 0.4253], endpoint at [0.0, 0.3958] - Line 4: Start point at [0.0, 0.3958], endpoint at [0.0, 0.0417] 3. **Scale the sketch** Apply a uniform scale factor of 0.75 to the entire sketch. 4. **Transform the sketch to 3D** Rotate the sketch around the Z-axis by 0 degrees, the X-axis by 0 degrees and the Y-axis by 0 degrees. The sketch now lies on the X-Y plane in 3D space. 5. **Extrude the sketch** Extrude the sketch by 0.4167 units along the Z-axis, which is perpendicular to the sketching plane, creating a 3D prism. Use the 'NewBodyFeatureOperation' boolean operation, meaning the extruded sketch will be treated as a solid, distinct from any pre-existing solids. The dimensions of the final prism are as follows: - length: 0.75 units - width: 0.75 units - height: 0.4167 units The actual production of the CAD model should maintain the aforementioned guidelines and numerical values to ensure the accurate creation of the described prism.</description>
